Package com.codecool.shop.dao.implementation

Class SupplierDaoJDBC

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.codecool.shop.dao.implementation.SupplierDaoJDBC
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SupplierDao

    public class SupplierDaoJDBC
extends java.lang.Object
implements SupplierDao
    This class is a supplier data access object which helps the Supplier class to communicate with the database.

    It implements the SupplierDao interface. It has 4 methods, one, that adds a Supplier instance to the database, one, that removes it if necessary, one, that returns all suppliers in a list and one for searching for a supplier in the database.

    Since:
    2018-01-17

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static SupplierDaoJDBC getInstance​()
        This method checks if an instance does not already exist. If not, a new instance of the class is created and assigned to the instance variable. If an existing instance is available, the getInstance method returns this. The result is that the returned value is always the same instance, and no new resource or overhead is required.
        Returns:
        a single instance of the class

      • add

        public void add​(Supplier supplier)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method adds a Supplier to the database. It has one parameter, which is of Supplier type, that gets inserted into the database. If the argument is null it throws an IllegalArgumentException.
        Specified by:
        add in interface SupplierDao
        Parameters:
        supplier - this is the Supplier that gets added to the DB
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameter supplier equals to null

      • find

        public Supplier find​(int id)
        This method searches for the Supplier in the database based on its id.

        It uses the ConnectionHandler class to establish connection to the database. If it fails, it logs a warning about connection failure, if it doesn't find the id in the DB, it returns null. However if the Supplier is found based on the id than it gets returned.

        Specified by:
        find in interface SupplierDao
        Parameters:
        id - the Supplier will be searched for based on this id
        Returns:
        the Supplier which has the corresponding id

      • remove

        public void remove​(int id)
        This method removes the Supplier that has the id given by the parameter.

        It uses the ConnectionHandler class to establish connection to the database. If it fails, it logs a warning about connection failure. However, if the Supplier is found based on the id, then it gets removed.

        Specified by:
        remove in interface SupplierDao
        Parameters:
        id - the Supplier will be removed based on this id

      • getAll

        public java.util.List<Supplier> getAll​()
        This method gets all the suppliers from the database and returns them in a list.

        It uses the ConnectionHandler class to establish connection to the database. If it fails, it logs a warning about connection failure. However, if the connection went through without problems, then it returns all the suppliers in an ArrayList.

        Specified by:
        getAll in interface SupplierDao
        Returns:
        an ArrayList, which contains all the suppliers
